titles.title: Virgin Islands and Guam Constitutional Self-Government Act of 2000
Virgin Islands and Guam Constitutional Self-Government Act of 2000
To clarify the process for the adoption of local constitutional self-government for the United States Virgin Islands and Guam, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-745.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 426.

bill.summary: 7/17/2000--Reported to House amended. Virgin Islands and Guam Constitutional Self-Government Act of 2000 - Amends Federal law regarding the Virgin Islands and Guam to provide that: (1) the President may include in his or her comments to Congress with respect to each constitution that is received from the Virgin Islands or Guam recommendations regarding which provisions of the relevant Organic Act should be repealed when the constitution takes effect; and (2) establishment of local constitutional self-government does not preclude or prejudice further future exercise of the right of self-determination regarding the ultimate political status of either such territory.
